invention_title: Method of fixing a flexible flat cable to a cable holder

definitions.definition: A '''cable''' is two or more [[wire]]s running side by side and bonded, twisted or braided together to form a single assembly. In [[mechanics]] cables, otherwise known as [[wire rope]]s, are used for lifting, hauling and towing or conveying force through tension. In [[electrical engineering]] cables are used to carry [[electric current]]s. An optical cable contains one or more [[optical fiber]]s in a protective jacket that supports the fibers.

'''Cable television''' is a system of providing [[television program]]s to consumers via [[radio frequency]] (RF) signals transmitted to televisions through [[coaxial cable]]s or digital light pulses through fixed [[optical fiber]]s located on the subscriber's property, much like the over-the-air method used in [[Terrestrial television|traditional television broadcasting]] (via [[radio waves]]) in which a [[television antenna]] is required. [[FM radio]] programming, [[high-speed Internet]], [[telephony]], and similar non-television services may also be provided. The major difference is the change of radio frequency signals used and optical connections to the subscriber property.

An '''electrical connector''' is an [[electro-mechanical]] device for joining [[electrical circuit]]s as an [[interface]] using a mechanical assembly. The connection may be temporary, as for portable equipment, require a tool for assembly and removal, or serve as a permanent electrical joint between two wires or devices.
An '''adapter''' or '''adaptor''' is a person that adapts or a [[tool|device]] that converts attributes of one device or system to those of an otherwise incompatible device or system.

A '''flange''' is an external or internal [[Ridge (disambiguation)|ridge]], or [[Rim (wheel)|rim]] (lip), for [[Shear strength|strength]], as the flange of an [[iron]] [[Beam (structure)|beam]] such as an [[I-beam]] or a [[T-beam]]; or for attachment to another object, as the flange on the end of a pipe, steam cylinder, etc., or on the [[lens mount]] of a [[camera]]; or for a flange of a [[rail car]] or [[tram]] [[wheel]]. Thus flanged wheels are wheels with a flange on one side to keep the wheels, from running off the [[Rail profile|rails]]. The term "flange" is also used for a kind of tool used to form flanges. [[Pipe (fluid conveyance)|Pipes]] with flanges can be assembled and disassembled easily.
